title: Democrats Officially Take Control of the U.S. Senate
sub_head: Vice President Harris will break any ties in 50-50 chamber
body:
Democrats now officially control the U.S. Senate, with the swearing in of three new Democratic senators.
Vice President Kamala Harris administered the oath of office on Wednesday to newly elected Democratic Sens. Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff of Georgia and to her own successor, Democratic Sen. Alex Padilla of California.
The Senate now has 50 Democrats and 50 Republicans, and Ms. Harris will cast any tiebreaking vote.
Messrs. Warnock and Ossoff are Georgiaâ€™s first Black and first Jewish senators, respectively. And Mr. Padilla is the first Latino senator from California.
The Senate will now look to quickly confirm nominees. Late in the day, the Senate confirmed Avril Haines as director of national intelligence, the first Biden cabinet secretary to be approved by the Senate.
